article.headline: Hartford 76, Stony Brook 65
article.story: STONY BROOK, N.Y. (AP) -- Paris Carter scored 24 points and Ken Adeleke added 20 points and 16 rebounds to help Hartford extend Stony Brook's losing streak to seven games with a 76-65 victory Thursday night. Aaron Cook added 19 points for the Hawks (13-13, 9-6 America East), who held a 34-26 advantage at halftime on the way to their fourth straight win. Mitchell Beauford scored 15 points to lead the Seawolves (4-22, 2-13) while Antwan Hardy and Mike Popoko each had 12. Chris Cole connected on a layup and a 3-pointer as the Hawks, who never trailed, held a 7-2 lead less than two minutes into the game. Two free throws by Beauford cut the lead to 19-18 at 8:12. But Carter's 3 closed out an 11-3 run that increased the lead to 30-21. In the second half Hartford led by as many as 14 twice, the last time when Carter's tip-in made it 65-51 with 5:22 left.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
